My constituents cannot afford another crash. They lost their homes, jobs, and many of them are still recovering. That‚Äôs why today at @FSCDems hearing I asked about how we can help protect our communities from these #shadowbanks, which have been deregulated under Trump.

AIG. Bear Stearns. Lehman Brothers. 

We know the names all too well. The size and complexity of these financial institutions made them central to the '08 crash. But Trump appointees have removed protections from these non-bank financial companies, which puts us at risk.

Large financial non-banks aka shadow banks were at the center of the 2008 economic crisis, yet they mostly stood outside the regulatory system. I am worried that we have failed to learn the lessons of '08 and are making the same mistakes again. https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/11/shadow-banking-is-now-a-52-trillion-industry-and-posing-risks.html¬†‚Ä¶

A5: The solution to reducing emissions isn't just better fuel efficiency & electric cars. The historical ratio of 80% funding for roads & 20% for transit (bus, trains, subways) is outdated & based on decisions from the 1980s. It‚Äôs time we revisit that & stop accepting the status quo. Change is hard, but we can build the kind of cities we want to live in. #BeyondEVs https://twitter.com/T4America/status/1174390522250764295¬†‚Ä¶

A3: That also means building more affordable, multi-family housing units & community assets (grocery stores/shops) along bus & transit routes. That equation equals less miles driven, more affordable housing, & access to everything you need without a car. #BeyondEVs #EquitableTOD

A3: I‚Äôm launching the Future of Transportation Caucus with @RepPressley to address these exact issues. We need better land-use policy like using more equitable transit-oriented development (eTOD). https://twitter.com/T4America/status/1174386209075945481¬†‚Ä¶
